fear.bodyLanguage: Head and eyes up, shoulders back but relaxed. Assertive.
fear.oppositeAction: Do something you know will give you a sense of control & mastery. If you're able to step back for a few moments, do so and remember a situation where you truly felt in control.

anger.options: anger, angry, mad, pissed off, pissed, livid
anger.bodyLanguage: Unclench hands. Relax chest and stomach. Unclench teeth. Relax face, half smile.
anger.oppositeAction: Take a time out. Be kind. Be understanding. It's OK to avoid the person or situation that makes you made (if appropriate).
anger.breathing: If you can go for a sprint or similar physical exertion, do it! If you can't, some slow paced breathing can help.

envy.bodyLanguage: Bright posture. Open your shoulders and relax your arms.
envy.oppositeAction: Think of 3 blessings / things you are thankful for.

jealous.bodyLanguage: Bright posture. Open your shoulders and relax your arms.
jealous.oppositeAction: Let go of controlling others actions. Share the things and people you have in your life. Appreciate the good things that you do have.
jealous.breathing: Stepping back for a few moments and breathing slowly while clearing your head can help.

sad.options: sad, sadness, like crying, upset, depressed
sad.bodyLanguage: Adopt a bright posture. Head up, eyes open, shoulders back.
sad.oppositeAction: Don't avoid. Be mindful of sadness but also think of pleasant events. Think of a few things you're super thankful to have in your life (people, places, things, anything really).
sad.breathing: 'Breathe in' the pleasant events and 'breathe out' the sadness. Don't try to get rid of it, rather allow it to coexist with whatever pleasant thoughts you have.

shame.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
shame.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Think of a few things you feel proud about.
shame.breathing: If you have some time to explore the shame with someone you trust you can, but in the moment the best thing to do is adopt a proud posture and think of moments of pride.

guilt.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
guilt.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

anxiety.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

happy.message: Feeling happy is obviously the goal, so let's keep it this way!
